intro: Paronychia paranensis, commonly known as the Paraguay sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Paraguay and Argentina. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and shrublands. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Paronychia paranensis is adapted to arid environments and is often used in traditional medicine in its native regions.
